results.title: Forbidden planet
results.creator_credit: Fred Wilcox, Nicholas Nayfack and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The year is 2257AD and the distant planet Altair-IV has three lone inhabitants: Professor Morbius (Walter Pidgeon), a fugitive super-scientist who has created a world of futuristic marvels; his daughter Altaira (Ann Francis), a bewitching innocent who has lived her entire life on the planet: and their servant, Robby the Robot. Then Commander Adams (Leslie Nielsen) arrives, and what ensues is a spine-chilling adventure with a hint of romance. “Forbidden planet” became a cult classic.

results.title: Little women
results.brief_description: Louisa May Alcott’s popular novel is brought vividly to life in this second screen adaption of “Little Women.” The March sisters are Jo (June Allyson), Beth (Janet Leigh), Amy (a blonde Elizabeth Taylor) and Meg (child-star Margaret O’Brien). Their father has left for the Civil War, leaving the girls under the watchful eye of their mother (Mary Astor). Far removed from war and safe within their New England home, the “little women” are a closely-knit family and a picture of happiness. When Laurie (Peter Lawford), the grandson of a rich neighbor arrives, the orderly world of the March family is disrupted. The sisters are smitten by this handsome stranger and a story of romance, rivalry, love and loss ensues. As the high spirited and determined Jo, June Allyson gives one of the finest performances of her career, ably supported by the superb ensemble cast. The film is beautifully crafted and deservedly received an Academy Award nomination for its exceptional cinematography. Co-starring Rossano Brazzi as Professor Bhaer.

results.title: Reservoir dogs
results.creator_credit: Quentin Tarantino, Lawrence Bender and Dog Eat Dog Productions
results.brief_description: This exciting and controversial independent feature cemented Tarantino’s reputation as an important filmmaker. A brilliant ensemble cast, including Harvey Keital, Steve Buscemi, Tim Roth and Michael Masden, play a gang of armed robbers involved in a heist that goes comically wrong. Featuring a tight and witty script, this audaciously fast-moving film is influenced by the jubilant cinema of the French New Wave. It is also influenced by a gleefully indulgent love of American pop culture. On its release “Reservoir Dogs” was criticised for its violence, in particular, an unsettling torture scene in which Masden takes sadistic pleasure in murdering a cop. It is the mixing of sadism with a comically amoral detachment that marks the film’s break with the Hollywood tradition of the gangster epic and the film noir. There is no sentimental resolution to “Reservoir Dogs”, no clear-cut good guys and bad guys. An astonishingly assured first feature, that is rivetting, disturbing, funny and sometimes suprisingly homoerotic.

results.title: Cat people
results.creator_credit: Paul Schrader, Charles Fries, RKO Radio Pictures and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: A re-make of the 1942 horror classic starring Nastassia Kinski, Malcolm McDowell and John Heard. Irena is a beautiful young woman on the brink of exploring her sexuality. The experience brings tragic consequences and pushes her towards her bizarre destiny as her past and present collide. The orginal story held that an ancient race of women mated with big cats in the dawn of time. To become human again after mating, the “Cat people” must kill. Irena, who is in love with a human is condemned to repeat the patterns of her ancestors.

results.title: Blade runner [Director's cut]
results.creator_credit: Ridley Scott, Michael Deeley, Bud Yorkin, Jerry Perenchio, Sir Run Run Shaw and Ladd Company
results.brief_description: Ridley Scott’s adaptation of Philip K. Dick’s novel “Do androids dream of electric sheep” has rapidly become a classic of the science fiction genre. In Los Angeles, 2019, Deckard, a licensed-to-kill cop is given the task of tracking down and destroying a group of intelligent androids who have hijacked a space shuttle and returned to Earth. In the process Deckard has to confront disturbing questions about what makes a human being. “A richly detailed and visually overwhelming trip to the future which sticks with you like a recurrent nightmare.” Starring Harrison Ford, Rutger Hauer and Sean Young.

results.title: The Big red one
results.creator_credit: Samuel Fuller, Gene Corman, United Artists Corporation and Lorimar Film Entertainment
results.brief_description: The combat Sergeant’s duty is to make sure that the men under his charge stay alive. Some of them are barely out of high school and must face the mental and physical challenges of war. The First Infantry Division’s insignia is named the “Big Red One’. The men in this division battle their way through North Africa, Sicily, Omaha Beach and Belgium until they confront the horrors of the Nazi Death Camps. Lee Marvin is the Sergeant, joined by Mark Hamill and Robert Carradine in this excellent portrayal of the realities and horror of war.

results.title: Saturday night fever
results.creator_credit: John Badham, Robert Stigwood and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: John Travolta and Karen Gorney star in the film that brought the “seventies generation” out of their homes and into the disco wearing gaberdine pants and platform shoes. After a week of work in a hardware store, Tony transforms himself into the local Disco King. His new dance partner Stephanie, and ex-priest brother, has Tony questioning the shallowness of his life. It is a fine piece of cinema, being not simply a disco dance, but a striking social commentary. The film is memorable for its great soundtrack; the original music being performed and written by the Bee Gees, for the excellence of the dancing and a fantastic performance from Travolta. A must for those who want to re-live a bygone era and connoisseurs of fashion.

results.title: Horse feathers
results.brief_description: Groucho, Harpo, Chico and Zeppo star in this anarchic parody of college life. As the President of Huxley College, Groucho is busy keeping his eye on the students, as well as on the curves of vivacious college widow Thelma Todd. She is secretly trying to find the secret football codes to sell to rival college Darwin. “Horse Feathers” includes the riotious classroom war scene and the climatic football game finale where all the rules are broken!

results.title: Return of the Jedi
results.creator_credit: Richard Marquand, Howard Kazanjian and Lucasfilm, Ltd.
results.brief_description: The conclusion of the “Star Wars” trilogy begins with the rescue of Hans Solo from the evil clutches of Jabba the Hutt. The Galactic Empire has resurrected the Death Star and plans to eliminate the Rebel Alliance once and for all. Luke Skywalker, grappling with the secret that Darth Vader is his father, who was turned evil by the Dark Side of the Force, must confront the Emperor in one final battle. From the seedy den of Jabba the Hutt, to the luscious green peacefulness of the planet Endor with its Ewoks, “The Return of the Jedi” is an entralling action-packed special effects adventure.

results.title: The Empire strikes back
results.creator_credit: Irvin Kershner, Gary Kurtz and Lucasfilm, Ltd.
results.brief_description: The second of the “Star wars trilogy” is a blacker film than the previous “Star Wars.” The Rebel Alliance, defeated by the Empire on the ice planet of Hoth, must seek refuge elsewhere in order to re-group. Luke Skywalker goes to the planet of Dagobah to complete his training with the Jedi Master, Yoda. Hans, Leia and Chewbacca escape, but the evil reach of the Empire means that a confrontation between good and evil is inevitable. Luke as a fledgling Jedi, must face Darth Vader, who uses a terrible secret and the power of the Dark Side of the Force, to lure Luke to destruction. Includes a ten minute interview between Leonard Maltin and George Lucas.
